title: Avocado & Berry Breakfast Bowl
description: A powerful and antioxidant-rich start to your day, ready in 5 minutes.
steps: In a blender, combine the banana, frozen berries, oats, and almond milk. Blend until smooth.
Pour the smoothie into a bowl.
Top with sliced avocado, a sprinkle of chia seeds, and a drizzle of honey if desired.
Enjoy immediately!

title: Quinoa Salad with Lemon-Herb Dressing
description: A light, protein-packed salad perfect for lunch. Gluten-free and easily customizable.
steps: In a large bowl, combine the cooled quinoa, cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, and parsley.
In a small jar, shake together the olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to meld.

title: One-Pan Lemon Herb Salmon & Asparagus
description: An elegant yet simple dinner that's full of flavor and healthy omega-3s.
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
On a baking sheet, toss asparagus with 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Place salmon fillets on the same sheet. Drizzle with remaining oil. Rub with garlic, dill, salt, and pepper. Top with lemon slices.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through and flakes easily.
Serve immediately, garnished with extra fresh herbs.

title: Apple and Peanut Butter
description: A quick and satisfying snack that's perfect for any time of day.
steps: Core and slice the apple.
Spread peanut butter on each slice.
Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with chia seeds if desired.
Enjoy immediately!

title: Greek Yogurt with Honey and Nuts
description: A creamy and protein-packed snack that's both delicious and nutritious.
steps: Spoon the Greek yogurt into a bowl.
Drizzle with honey.
Top with mixed nuts.
Enjoy immediately!

title: Veggie Stir-Fry with Tofu
description: A quick and easy stir-fry packed with colorful vegetables and protein-rich tofu.
ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, drained and cubed
2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, snap peas, carrots)
Cooked rice or noodles for serving
steps: Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the cubed tofu and cook until golden brown on all sides. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add sesame oil, garlic, and ginger. Sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the mixed vegetables and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until tender-crisp.
Return the tofu to the skillet and pour in the soy sauce. Toss everything together and cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve over cooked rice or noodles.
